ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: When we need support such as advice, understanding or a favor, our relationships with other people (for example, parents, spouses, friends), may or may not have both helpful and upsetting aspects. For the following questionnaire, in each category (Significant Other and Parents, Other Family Members, Friends, Co-Workers, and Social Acquaintances), please note the relationship of the person in your life with whom you have contact.
Notes: 1= Significant Other; 2= Mother; 3= Father; 4= Family Member 1; 5= Family Member 2; 6= Family Member 3; 7= Family Member 4; 8= Family Member 5; 9= Friend 1; 10= Friend 2; 11= Friend 3; 12= Friend 4; 13= Friend 5; 14= Coworker 1; 15= Coworker 2; 16= Coworker 3; 17= Coworker 4; 18= Coworker 5; 19= Social Acquaintance 1; 20= Social Acquaintance 2; 21= Social Acquaintance 3; 22= Social Acquaintance 4; 23= Social Acquaintance 5

ElementDescription:
Approximate length of time you have known the person:
(years or months)
Average number of times per week you have contact with the person:
HOW IMPORTANT is the person to you?
HOW LIKELY are you to go to this person for support?
When you need support such as advice, understanding or a favor HOW HELPFUL is this person to you?
HOW UPSETTING is this person to you?
HOW MIXED OR CONFLICTED are your thoughts and feelings for the person?
HOW UNPREDICTABLE is this person to you?
